comment:
* This class provides information about and manages roles. *

* A role is a unique name within the system associated with certain privileges. The list of * available roles might change with a system app update, so apps should not make assumption about * the availability of roles. Instead, they should always query if the role is available using * {@link #isRoleAvailable(String)} before trying to do anything with it. Some predefined role names * are available as constants in this class, and a list of possibly available roles can be found in * the AndroidX Role * library. *

* There can be multiple applications qualifying for a role, but only a subset of them can become * role holders. To qualify for a role, an application must meet certain requirements, including * defining certain components in its manifest. These requirements can be found in the AndroidX * Libraries. Then the application will need user consent to become a role holder, which can be * requested using {@link android.app.Activity#startActivityForResult(Intent, int)} with the * {@code Intent} obtained from {@link #createRequestRoleIntent(String)}. *

* Upon becoming a role holder, the application may be granted certain privileges that are role * specific. When the application loses its role, these privileges will also be revoked.

variables.name: ROLE_ASSISTANT
variables.comment:
* The name of the assistant app role.
     *
     * @see android.service.voice.VoiceInteractionService

variables.name: ROLE_BROWSER
variables.comment:
* The name of the browser role.
     *
     * @see Intent#CATEGORY_APP_BROWSER

variables.name: ROLE_DIALER
variables.comment:
* The name of the dialer role.
     *
     * @see Intent#ACTION_DIAL
     * @see android.telecom.InCallService

variables.name: ROLE_SMS
variables.comment:
* The name of the SMS role.
     *
     * @see Intent#CATEGORY_APP_MESSAGING

variables.name: ROLE_EMERGENCY
variables.comment: * The name of the emergency role

variables.name: ROLE_HOME
variables.comment:
* The name of the home role.
     *
     * @see Intent#CATEGORY_HOME

variables.name: ROLE_CALL_REDIRECTION
variables.comment:
* The name of the call redirection role. *

* A call redirection app provides a means to re-write the phone number for an outgoing call to * place the call through a call redirection service. * * @see android.telecom.CallRedirectionService

variables.name: ROLE_CALL_SCREENING
variables.comment:
* The name of the call screening and caller id role.
     *
     * @see android.telecom.CallScreeningService

variables.name: MANAGE_HOLDERS_FLAG_DONT_KILL_APP
variables.comment:
* Flag parameter for {@link #addRoleHolderAsUser}, {@link #removeRoleHolderAsUser} and
     * {@link #clearRoleHoldersAsUser} to indicate that apps should not be killed when changing
     * their role holder status.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: ACTION_REQUEST_ROLE
variables.comment:
* The action used to request user approval of a role for an application.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: PERMISSION_MANAGE_ROLES_FROM_CONTROLLER
variables.comment:
* The permission required to manage records of role holders in {@link RoleManager} directly.
     *
     * @hide

methods.name: public Intent createRequestRoleIntent(@NonNull String roleName)
methods.comment:
* Returns an {@code Intent} suitable for passing to * {@link android.app.Activity#startActivityForResult(Intent, int)} which prompts the user to * grant a role to this application. *

* If the role is granted, the {@code resultCode} will be * {@link android.app.Activity#RESULT_OK}, otherwise it will be * {@link android.app.Activity#RESULT_CANCELED}. * * @param roleName the name of requested role * * @return the {@code Intent} to prompt user to grant the role

methods.name: public boolean isRoleAvailable(@NonNull String roleName)
methods.comment:
* Check whether a role is available in the system.
     *
     * @param roleName the name of role to checking for
     *
     * @return whether the role is available in the system

methods.name: public boolean isRoleHeld(@NonNull String roleName)
methods.comment:
* Check whether the calling application is holding a particular role.
     *
     * @param roleName the name of the role to check for
     *
     * @return whether the calling application is holding the role

methods.name: public List<String> getRoleHolders(@NonNull String roleName)
methods.comment:
* Get package names of the applications holding the role. *

* Note: Using this API requires holding * {@code android.permission.MANAGE_ROLE_HOLDERS}. * * @param roleName the name of the role to get the role holder for * * @return a list of package names of the role holders, or an empty list if none. * * @see #getRoleHoldersAsUser(String, UserHandle) * * @hide

methods.name: public List<String> getRoleHoldersAsUser(@NonNull String roleName, @NonNull UserHandle user)
methods.comment:
* Get package names of the applications holding the role. *

* Note: Using this API requires holding * {@code android.permission.MANAGE_ROLE_HOLDERS} and if the user id is not the current user * {@code android.permission.INTERACT_ACROSS_USERS_FULL}. * * @param roleName the name of the role to get the role holder for * @param user the user to get the role holder for * * @return a list of package names of the role holders, or an empty list if none. * * @see #addRoleHolderAsUser(String, String, int, UserHandle, Executor, Consumer) * @see #removeRoleHolderAsUser(String, String, int, UserHandle, Executor, Consumer) * @see #clearRoleHoldersAsUser(String, int, UserHandle, Executor, Consumer) * * @hide

methods.name: public void addRoleHolderAsUser(@NonNull String roleName, @NonNull String packageName, @ManageHoldersFlags int flags, @NonNull UserHandle user, @CallbackExecutor @NonNull Executor executor, @NonNull Consumer<Boolean> callback)
methods.comment:
* Add a specific application to the holders of a role. If the role is exclusive, the previous * holder will be replaced. *

* Note: Using this API requires holding * {@code android.permission.MANAGE_ROLE_HOLDERS} and if the user id is not the current user * {@code android.permission.INTERACT_ACROSS_USERS_FULL}. * * @param roleName the name of the role to add the role holder for * @param packageName the package name of the application to add to the role holders * @param flags optional behavior flags * @param user the user to add the role holder for * @param executor the {@code Executor} to run the callback on. * @param callback the callback for whether this call is successful * * @see #getRoleHoldersAsUser(String, UserHandle) * @see #removeRoleHolderAsUser(String, String, int, UserHandle, Executor, Consumer) * @see #clearRoleHoldersAsUser(String, int, UserHandle, Executor, Consumer) * * @hide

methods.name: public void removeRoleHolderAsUser(@NonNull String roleName, @NonNull String packageName, @ManageHoldersFlags int flags, @NonNull UserHandle user, @CallbackExecutor @NonNull Executor executor, @NonNull Consumer<Boolean> callback)
methods.comment:
* Remove a specific application from the holders of a role. *

* Note: Using this API requires holding * {@code android.permission.MANAGE_ROLE_HOLDERS} and if the user id is not the current user * {@code android.permission.INTERACT_ACROSS_USERS_FULL}. * * @param roleName the name of the role to remove the role holder for * @param packageName the package name of the application to remove from the role holders * @param flags optional behavior flags * @param user the user to remove the role holder for * @param executor the {@code Executor} to run the callback on. * @param callback the callback for whether this call is successful * * @see #getRoleHoldersAsUser(String, UserHandle) * @see #addRoleHolderAsUser(String, String, int, UserHandle, Executor, Consumer) * @see #clearRoleHoldersAsUser(String, int, UserHandle, Executor, Consumer) * * @hide

methods.name: public void clearRoleHoldersAsUser(@NonNull String roleName, @ManageHoldersFlags int flags, @NonNull UserHandle user, @CallbackExecutor @NonNull Executor executor, @NonNull Consumer<Boolean> callback)
methods.comment:
* Remove all holders of a role. *

* Note: Using this API requires holding * {@code android.permission.MANAGE_ROLE_HOLDERS} and if the user id is not the current user * {@code android.permission.INTERACT_ACROSS_USERS_FULL}. * * @param roleName the name of the role to remove role holders for * @param flags optional behavior flags * @param user the user to remove role holders for * @param executor the {@code Executor} to run the callback on. * @param callback the callback for whether this call is successful * * @see #getRoleHoldersAsUser(String, UserHandle) * @see #addRoleHolderAsUser(String, String, int, UserHandle, Executor, Consumer) * @see #removeRoleHolderAsUser(String, String, int, UserHandle, Executor, Consumer) * * @hide

methods.name: private static RemoteCallback createRemoteCallback(@NonNull Executor executor, @NonNull Consumer<Boolean> callback)
public void addOnRoleHoldersChangedListenerAsUser(@CallbackExecutor @NonNull Executor executor, @NonNull OnRoleHoldersChangedListener listener, @NonNull UserHandle user)
methods.comment:
* Add a listener to observe role holder changes *

* Note: Using this API requires holding * {@code android.permission.OBSERVE_ROLE_HOLDERS} and if the user id is not the current user * {@code android.permission.INTERACT_ACROSS_USERS_FULL}. * * @param executor the {@code Executor} to call the listener on. * @param listener the listener to be added * @param user the user to add the listener for * * @see #removeOnRoleHoldersChangedListenerAsUser(OnRoleHoldersChangedListener, UserHandle) * * @hide

methods.name: public void removeOnRoleHoldersChangedListenerAsUser(@NonNull OnRoleHoldersChangedListener listener, @NonNull UserHandle user)
methods.comment:
* Remove a listener observing role holder changes *

* Note: Using this API requires holding * {@code android.permission.OBSERVE_ROLE_HOLDERS} and if the user id is not the current user * {@code android.permission.INTERACT_ACROSS_USERS_FULL}. * * @param listener the listener to be removed * @param user the user to remove the listener for * * @see #addOnRoleHoldersChangedListenerAsUser(Executor, OnRoleHoldersChangedListener, * UserHandle) * * @hide

methods.name: public void setRoleNamesFromController(@NonNull List<String> roleNames)
methods.comment:
* Set the names of all the available roles. Should only be called from * {@link android.app.role.RoleControllerService}. *

* Note: Using this API requires holding * {@link #PERMISSION_MANAGE_ROLES_FROM_CONTROLLER}. * * @param roleNames the names of all the available roles * * @hide

methods.name: public boolean addRoleHolderFromController(@NonNull String roleName, @NonNull String packageName)
methods.comment:
* Add a specific application to the holders of a role, only modifying records inside * {@link RoleManager}. Should only be called from * {@link android.app.role.RoleControllerService}. *

* Note: Using this API requires holding * {@link #PERMISSION_MANAGE_ROLES_FROM_CONTROLLER}. * * @param roleName the name of the role to add the role holder for * @param packageName the package name of the application to add to the role holders * * @return whether the operation was successful, and will also be {@code true} if a matching * role holder is already found. * * @see #getRoleHolders(String) * @see #removeRoleHolderFromController(String, String) * * @hide

methods.name: public boolean removeRoleHolderFromController(@NonNull String roleName, @NonNull String packageName)
methods.comment:
* Remove a specific application from the holders of a role, only modifying records inside * {@link RoleManager}. Should only be called from * {@link android.app.role.RoleControllerService}. *

* Note: Using this API requires holding * {@link #PERMISSION_MANAGE_ROLES_FROM_CONTROLLER}. * * @param roleName the name of the role to remove the role holder for * @param packageName the package name of the application to remove from the role holders * * @return whether the operation was successful, and will also be {@code true} if no matching * role holder was found to remove. * * @see #getRoleHolders(String) * @see #addRoleHolderFromController(String, String) * * @hide

methods.name: public List<String> getHeldRolesFromController(@NonNull String packageName)
methods.comment:
* Returns the list of all roles that the given package is currently holding
     *
     * @param packageName the package name
     * @return the list of role names
     *
     * @hide

methods.name: public String getDefaultSmsPackage(@UserIdInt int userId)
methods.comment:
* Allows getting the role holder for {@link #ROLE_SMS} without
     * {@link Manifest.permission#OBSERVE_ROLE_HOLDERS}, as required by
     * {@link android.provider.Telephony.Sms#getDefaultSmsPackage(Context)}
     *
     * @param userId The user ID to get the default SMS package for.
     * @return the package name of the default SMS app, or {@code null} if not configured.
     * @hide

methodNames: public List<String> getRoleHoldersAsUser(@NonNull String roleName, @NonNull UserHandle user)

public void addRoleHolderAsUser(@NonNull String roleName, @NonNull String packageName, @ManageHoldersFlags int flags, @NonNull UserHandle user, @CallbackExecutor @NonNull Executor executor, @NonNull Consumer<Boolean> callback)

public void removeRoleHolderAsUser(@NonNull String roleName, @NonNull String packageName, @ManageHoldersFlags int flags, @NonNull UserHandle user, @CallbackExecutor @NonNull Executor executor, @NonNull Consumer<Boolean> callback)

public void clearRoleHoldersAsUser(@NonNull String roleName, @ManageHoldersFlags int flags, @NonNull UserHandle user, @CallbackExecutor @NonNull Executor executor, @NonNull Consumer<Boolean> callback)
private static RemoteCallback createRemoteCallback(@NonNull Executor executor, @NonNull Consumer<Boolean> callback)
public void addOnRoleHoldersChangedListenerAsUser(@CallbackExecutor @NonNull Executor executor, @NonNull OnRoleHoldersChangedListener listener, @NonNull UserHandle user)
public void removeOnRoleHoldersChangedListenerAsUser(@NonNull OnRoleHoldersChangedListener listener, @NonNull UserHandle user)
public boolean addRoleHolderFromController(@NonNull String roleName, @NonNull String packageName)
public boolean removeRoleHolderFromController(@NonNull String roleName, @NonNull String packageName)
